title: Jimmy Carter National Historic Site: Eating & Sleeping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping             Eating & Sleeping       Lodging     The Jimmy Carter National Historic Site has no park run lodging accommodations within the park. There are a couple of privately owned and operated inns in Plains, as well as a wide range of accommodations located in the surrounding area.      Restaurants   The town of Plains has two restaurants that offer a place to enjoy a meal. Mimmie's Diner and The Buffalo Cafe` at the Old Bank, offer a variety of food choices. There are also several chain restaurants in the town of Americus. Please visit the local Chamber of Commerce for more information.   In addition to the local restaurants, there are picnic tables located at the Visitor Center, the Boyhood Farm, the City Park and also at the Georgia Welcome Center, located just outside of Plains. There are no drink or snack machines in the park facilities; however, there are places in town to get refreshments.
